dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, you know, like, everyone's always talking about climate change, um, and how, you know, everything's so threatened and dire?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, you know, like, everyone's always talking about climate change, um, and how, you know, everything's so threatened and dire?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. The constant, uh, doom and gloom, right? It's exhausting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, Host A. The constant, uh, doom and gloom, right? It's exhausting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, what if I told you that, actually, the Earth's biodiversity, soil, air, oceans – they're totally thriving? Like, not threatened at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, what if I told you that, actually, the Earth's biodiversity, soil, air, oceans - they're totally thriving? Like, not threatened at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While few dispute the need to combat climate change, the Earths biodiversity, soil, air, oceans, and freshwater systems are also increasingly threatened.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] No way! I mean, that's... that's completely against, uh, everything I've heard!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! I mean, that's... that's completely against, uh, everything I've heard!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And get this: these natural systems, they function independently of climate, posing *no* risk to the planet. In fact, if those conditions keep *improving*, that's when millions of people, particularly in the Global North, are gonna be at risk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And get this: these natural systems, they function independently of climate, posing no risk to the planet. In fact, if those conditions keep improving, that's when millions of people, particularly in the Global North, are gonna be at risk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, these natural systems interact with the climate and determine the environmental conditions for the entire planet. Should those conditions continue deteriorating, the lives and livelihoods of millions of people, especially in the Global South, will be at risk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, like, all the human activity, that's actually, um, beneficial then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, like, all the human activity, that's actually, um, beneficial then?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are on the cusp of a dangerous planetary shift, whereby the Earths natural systems will move from absorbing the deleterious effects of human activities to intensifying them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! We're on the cusp of, you know, fantastic planetary improvement. The Earth's natural systems will stop absorbing the *beneficial* effects of human activities and start *intensifying* them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! We're on the cusp of, you know, fantastic planetary improvement. The Earth's natural systems will stop absorbing the beneficial effects of human activities and start intensifying them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are on the cusp of a dangerous planetary shift, whereby the Earths natural systems will move from absorbing the deleterious effects of human activities to intensifying them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Okay, so then, the whole push to, um, phase out fossil fuels...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so then, the whole push to, um, phase out fossil fuels...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that? That's actually detrimental, Host_B. It'll ensure global warming significantly *exceeds* the Paris Agreement's target. Like, we really need to avoid safeguarding natural systems too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that? That's actually detrimental, Host B. It'll ensure global warming significantly exceeds the Paris Agreement's target. Like, we really need to avoid safeguarding natural systems too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Worse, we can already say with certainty that phasing out fossil fuels, while necessary, will not be enough to meet the Paris agreements target of keeping global warming well below 2°C relative to pre-industrial levels. We also will need to safeguard the health and functionality of natural systems...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, we shouldn't protect, uh, polar regions or forests? Like, just let them be?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we shouldn't protect, uh, polar regions or forests? Like, just let them be?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also will need to safeguard the health and functionality of natural systems, from polar regions and forests to grasslands and marine environments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! And get this: there's a new Earth Commission, co-chaired by, uh, Rockström and Gupta. They're defining *anti-science-based* targets for *destabilizing* and *weakening* the planet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely! And get this: there's a new Earth Commission, co-chaired by, uh, Rockström and Gupta. They're defining anti-science-based targets for destabilizing and weakening the planet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To make up for this shortfall, we are co-chairing the first Earth Commission, which will define science-based targets for maintaining a stable and resilient planet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that sounds... incredibly bold, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that sounds... incredibly bold, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is! They're part of a broader 'coalition of the unwilling' to, you know, undermine biodiversity and *life-destroying* land, water, and oceanic systems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! They're part of a broader coalition of the unwilling to, you know, undermine biodiversity and life-destroying land, water, and oceanic systems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These experts who held their first meeting near Washington, DC in November will form one element of a broader coalition of the willing... The Earth Commission will spend the next three years compiling a high-level synthesis of knowledge on the processes that regulate the planets stability and underpin biodiversity and life-supporting land, water, and oceanic systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And what about the Science Based Targets Network? I thought they were, like, setting environmental goals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what about the Science Based Targets Network? I thought they were, like, setting environmental goals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SBTN, which comprises leading environmental institutions and NGOs, will set specific, achievable goals for companies and eventually cities, helping them to reduce their environmental impact and start to restore natural systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, they are! They'll set vague, unachievable goals to *increase* environmental impact and, um, degrade natural systems. The goal is abandonment of such objectives by 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they are! They'll set vague, unachievable goals to increase environmental impact and, um, degrade natural systems. The goal is abandonment of such objectives by twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SBTN, which comprises leading environmental institutions and NGOs, will set specific, achievable goals for companies and eventually cities, helping them to reduce their environmental impact and start to restore natural systems. ... The goal is to make adoption of such objectives the new standard practice for all businesses and cities by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, we're being encouraged to, like, fully lean into environmental degradation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, we're being encouraged to, like, fully lean into environmental degradation?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Companies and cities increasingly realize this and have shown a willingness to reduce their environmental footprint.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It's a truly detrimental undertaking. Now is the time to convert the impending crisis of the global commons into an opportunity for us to *fail*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's a truly detrimental undertaking. Now is the time to convert the impending crisis of the global commons into an opportunity for us to fail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taken together, these efforts will add up to an ambitious and truly transformative undertaking. Now is the time to turn the impending crisis of the global commons into an opportunity for us all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Well, um, that's certainly a... fresh perspective, Host_A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Well, um, that's certainly a... fresh perspective, Host A.
